item.title: Amin add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Amin add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Death is not the opposite of life, but a part of it." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Amin add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "No, writing has not changed me for the better at all; I have merely used up part of my restless, conscienceless youth. What value to me will these discontented pages be? The book, the vow, are worth no more than one is worth oneself. One can never be sure of saving one's soul by writing. One may go writing on and on with a soul already lost." -- Italo Calvino

item.title: Amin add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "The art of writing tales consists in an ability to draw the rest of life from the little one has understood of it; but life begins again at the end of the page, and one realises that one has knew nothing whatsoever." -- Italo Calvino
